title: `--standard-json` turns contracts absolute paths into wrong relative paths

body:
Did a little investigation into how Brownie/Ape handle this via [VVM](https://github.com/vyperlang/vvm):

Working with the command line, it calls out to the binaries directly using a temporary copy of the file in a tmp path via:
```sh
$ /path/to/.vvm/vyper-0.3.1 /tmp/vyper-18ivvvsd.vy -f combined_json -p /path/to/projects/contracts-dir
```
Note that `-p /path/to/projects/contracts-dir` arg is given just in case there are local imports from that file.

This gives a result from the subprocess, which is parsed from a json string, that looks like this:
```py
>>> stdoutdata                                   
'{"/tmp/vyper-18ivvvsd.vy": {"bytecode": "0x60206...", ...}\n'
```

I think it then goes back and replaces the contract files again with their local counterparts in order to write to whatever cache file `ethers-rs` is using. Tbh it's a little messy.

Either way, I think the `-p` arg is missing when you call out via subprocess.
@joshieDo can you check if https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper/pull/2677 resolves your issue?
i somehow totally missed it, sorry. tomorrow at latest, i'll check it

It kinda fixes it, but it's not the behavior I would expect...

So now it returns a valid relative path from where i called it, but in my opinion it should return an absolute path since that's what i provided.

> So now it returns a valid relative path from where i called it, but in my opinion it should return an absolute path since that's what i provided.

ah, interesting. i can do that.
@joshieDo should do what you want as of https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper/pull/2677/commits/65313d13c2db2c0a66bf172c673f790dfb5ac7ee

works perfectly now without patching vyper :partying_face: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93316087/164714543-de035cc5-742a-49f3-9252-f4733197baa6.png)
